thread.title: Auburn's starting quarterback a game time decision, says Malzahn
thread.title_full: Auburn's starting quarterback a game time decision, says Malzahn | AL.com

author: James Crepea | jcrepea@al.com
title: Auburn's starting quarterback a game time decision, says Malzahn
text:
Auburn head coach Gus Malzahn plans to wait until kickoff to announce his starting quarterback when the Tigers take on Kentucky Thursday night.
Malzahn announced the decision during Wednesday's SEC teleconference.
"We will have a decision before game time tomorrow," Malzahn said. "We'll just see how things go. We just felt like we needed to open up the competition to bring out the best in everybody."
Jeremy Johnson started the first three games of the season before being benched for redshirt freshman Sean White for the last two games.
"I think both of them have responded," Malzahn said. "I think both of them have improved and that's what we're looking for. The name of the game is improvement."
Johnson went 43 for 72 for 473 yards with five touchdowns and six interceptions in the first three games of the season.
RELATED: Johnson still acting like Auburn's starting QB, says former coach
Malzahn and offensive coordinator Rhett Lashlee have praised their longest serving pupil for his play on the practice field since being benched three weeks ago.
"I think his confidence is greatly improved," Lashlee said Sunday, "and I like what I see."
The 6-foot-5, 240 pound junior lost confidence following a woeful outing in a 45-21 loss to LSU on Sept. 19, in which Johnson went 11 for 19 for 100 yards with two late touchdowns and an interception, had a 65-yard rushing score, fumbled twice with one lost and was sacked five times.
RELATED: What happened to Auburn quarterback Jeremy Johnson?
Whoever starts will be tasked with taking over the helm of a struggling Auburn offense. The Tigers (3-2, 0-2 SEC) are averaging 153.8 passing yards per game, 13th in the SEC and 113th in the FBS .
White went 26 for 38 for 296 yards with an interception in his two starts, which were also his first collegiate action.
